item.title: The Horror of PLC Programming
Running docker on 32-bit hosts
item.description: Docker is known to not to support 32-bit hosts. As per their debian installation instruction: Docker CE is supported on x86_64 (or amd64), armhf, and arm64 architectures. And that is plain wrong. A tiny bit of extra support from docker-the-company would extend its use to older hardware, but (apparently) this is not a priority. “Let’s bring docker on 32-bit” issue was closed and locked in 2014, and nothing has changed since then.

item.title: alsa-utils' arecord bug: lots of *.wav files, ignoring --duration parameter
item.description: While working on a little side project, I found that I can’t record sound using Raspberry Pi with external USB sound card after upgrading it to Raspbian Jessie. Symptoms look rather weird: arecord doesn’t stop recording after a period of time specified by --duration flag, but keeps running and writing garbage to files like *-01.wav, *-02.wav and so on. Google doesn’t really give any solution to this (except the recommendation of terminating arecord using killall -KILL arecord after certain period of time).

item.title: Calibrating MAX31855 thermocouple amplifier
item.description: I have recently spent some time playing with Maxim 31855 chips, in a need of a precise and cheap K-type thermocouple logger. It is a simple voltage amplifier with digital SPI interface, so it works perfectly well with Raspberry Pi or Arduino. There are many thermocouple amplifiers out there, and I am sure that most of them are properly calibrated for temperatures around +/-50C, since even linear volt-to-degreeC conversion works fine in that range.

item.title: Amazon Fire TV 2nd Gen - Root & OpenVPN
item.description: My notes after spending half a day playing with my Fire TV. While Amazon Fire TV seems to be the best htpc solution for me, it still requires rooting and a bit of patching on its way to a decent media center. I’m also used to US streaming services (Pandora, Netflix, Hulu, etc.) that are only available through VPN, if you are outside of US. Rooting and setting up Kodi + OpenVPN is a way to go.
